text: [Applause]
aidan relief efforts are still faltering
in Haiti three days after a massive
earthquake destroyed the capital city of
port-au-prince on the phone with me now
from the American Embassy in the capital
city is Times reporter Damien cave
Damien I know you've been out with
search and rescue teams all night and
into this morning they tell us what that
experience was like well is interesting
the streets were pretty quiet in the
neighborhoods that we were in there were
people sleeping on the side of the road
sleeping in every Park States they could
climb and there were just a handful of
teams out digging through the buildings
for the last remaining survivors so
these teams it's been a real challenge
to get all their gear in here and to get
going and it's it's a real slog I mean
these buildings are in cakes all over
the city and trying to just figure out
where to go and which one city in to has
been a challenge huge probably know his
body's being left on the streets can you
tell us whether any progress is being
made and removing them well yesterday
afternoon when we first went out it
looked like there were bodies everywhere
and there was no one picking them up by
the end of the night though there were
dump trucks and loaders moving through
the city from the city sort of trash
collection collecting them and putting
you into that pickup truck delivering
them to the Mauri and other places is
there a sense of food and medical
supplies and water are actually getting
out to people in the streets in the
streets that seems to be very little
water and anything that any one sort of
goes to praise everyone is asking for
water so that does seem to be a serious
shortage for everyone
[Music]
